page.title: 18FARM COUNT
page.content: We took seven typical farms in our area with a total of 1172 acres. This showed that the average acreage was approximately 170. On this acreage 566 milking cows were kept, 155 beef cattle and 173 calves in total. This gave an average milking herd of about 80 per farm. Only two of the farms kept sheep and these had 256 between them. None of them kept pigs, one had a few free range poultry, while one went in for poultry in a bigger way and had 5000 birds. This last was a small farm making more intensive use of its acreage. Another small farm hired grass to graze its heifers, and went in for "strip grazing", restricting cattle to part of a field at one time. Normally farms of over 200 acres support 90 to 100 dairy cows.
